thread.title: A reason to vote in state and local elections
thread.title_full: A reason to vote in state and local elections - The Washington Post

author: washingtonpost.com
title: A reason to vote in state and local elections
text:
October 5 at 7:28 PM The Sept. 30 editorial “ The noncompete state ” seemed to justify why Virginia voters disengage even while it decried Republican efforts to block redistricting reform and argued that Virginia’s legislature is turning into a Politburo.
In the last election like 2015’s, when the greatest number of state and local candidates were on the ballot, large numbers of Democrats — perhaps having similar feelings about “all-but-meaningless” elections — stayed home and handed Republicans all substantially contested House of Delegates seats. Republican Bryce Reeves (Spotsylvania) won by 0.5 percent of the vote, making possible his party’s domination of Virginia’s Senate. Republicans squeaked by in significant local elections and extended their influence in setting county supervisor and school board district boundaries.
Is it any wonder reform opponents and their backers now make the laws that affect Virginians the most? They ignore The Post’s editorials and are most powerful at the ballot box when many don’t bother to vote. The next time the editorial board reminds Virginia readers that redistricting reform is overdue, it should point out this is an excellent reason to vote in the next state and local elections.
Marc Greidinger , Springfield
